title: 105_hr684
content: The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to include a new section regarding the treatment of funeral trusts under Subpart F of part I of subchapter J of chapter 1. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 addresses qualified funeral trusts, exempting them from certain provisions and deductions. A qualified funeral trust is defined as a trust established from a contract with a funeral service provider, solely for the purpose of funding funeral or burial services for beneficiaries who have entered into such contracts. The new section in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 exempts qualified funeral trusts from certain provisions and deductions. A qualified funeral trust is a trust established from a contract with a funeral service provider to fund funeral or burial services for beneficiaries. The trust must meet specific criteria, including a dollar limitation on contributions not exceeding $7,000. Trusts with related trustees are treated as one trust. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 exempts qualified funeral trusts from certain provisions and deductions. Trusts with related trustees are treated as one trust to prevent avoidance of the section's purposes. Inflation adjustments apply to contracts entered into after 1997. Trusts with related trustees are treated as one trust to prevent avoidance of the section's purposes. Inflation adjustments apply to contracts entered into after 1997. Section 1(f)(3) allows for adjustments to dollar amounts for calendar years. Section 1(e) applies the rate schedule to each qualified funeral trust separately. No gain or loss is recognized for beneficiaries on refunds from trust cancellations. The payment to beneficiaries from a qualified funeral trust can consist of property instead of money, with the beneficiary's basis being the same as the trust's basis before the payment. An exception applies if the trustee elects to pay income to a beneficiary, treating their interest as a separate trust. Simplified reporting rules may be prescribed for qualified funeral trusts with a single trustee. The IRS may prescribe simplified reporting for qualified funeral trusts with a single trustee. The amendments made by this section regarding the treatment of funeral trusts apply to taxable years ending after the enactment of the Act. Trusts established before the enactment date can make an election within one year as if it were made when the trust was established. The election can be made pursuant to an agreement described in section 684(f) entered into during the specified period.
